abstract: Standard Chartered reports quarterly pretax profit of $1.47 billion, down 22 percent from $1.88 billion in year-earlier period.
lead_paragraph: The drop comes as the bank prepares this year to replace its chief executive with William T. Winters, the former head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank.

headline.main: Standard Chartered Profit Declined 22 Percent in First Quarter

snippet: The drop comes as the bank prepares this year to replace its chief executive with William T. Winters, the former head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
